intro: Senecio serratus, commonly known as the serrated senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with narrow, serrated leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming during the summer months. Senecio serratus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
